bibl.title: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, October 30, 1947

div1.p: Hench discusses the upcoming Walter Reed Memorial Association annual meeting.

div1.head: Letter from J. F. Siler to Philip Showalter Hench, October 30, 1947
div1.opener:
Y. F.
GORGAS MEMORIAL INSTITUTE
OF
TROPICAL AND PREVENTIVE MEDICINE
INCORPORATED
1835 EYE STREET, NORTHWEST
WASHINGTON 6, D. C.
October 30, 1947
EXECUTIVE OFFICES
By air mail
My dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
As you doubtless will recall, the annual meeting of the Walter
Reed Memorial Association occurs in November. We have set the date
tentatively as November 17 or 18 for the meeting this year but before
sending out any notices, we wanted to find out if, by any chance, you
expect to be in this part of the country near that time. In case you
are to be in the East, would either of those dates be satisfactory to
you?

There is nothing special coming up this year unless you have
something to report. A slight change in the by-laws will be presented
for consideration. It was suggested by General Kean last year that the
Surgeon General of the Army be made a member of the Board automatically.
I will include the suggested amendment with the notices of the meeting
when they are sent, after hearing from you.

We are so glad that it will be possible for you to come to Wash-
ington next spring for the Walter Reed Celebration in connection with
the International Congresses on Tropical Medicine and Malaria.

I shall appreciate it if you will let me know as soon as possible
whether or not you will be able to be here for the Walter Reed Memorial
Association annual meeting.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours, J. F. Siler
Colonel, U.S.A., Retired
Secretary, Walter Reed Memorial
Association
3434 - 34th Place, N.W.
Washington 16, D.C. Colonel Philip S. Hench
The Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn
